page.title: 20Daily Life of an Elderly Man
page.content: Although I have already enjoyed over twenty years of retirement, after fifty years in the motor and allied trades, I am not as restricted in my activities as are many octogenarians, being reasonably fit and still able to drive. A Typical Timetable: 8.00-10.00a.m. Read the newspapers and any mail over breakfast. Do necessary household chores. 10.00-12.30p.m. Weather permitting, an hour or so in the garden. If wet or cold, writing or servicing household equipment. 12.30-2.00p.m.Lunch, wash up, followed by cup of tea and 'forty winks'. 2.00-5.00p.m. Usually out with car visiting housebound old friends or placeof interest with camera or at shops in a local town. 5.00-6.30p.m.Tea while seeing T.V.news. 6.30-10.00p.m.Watch T.V.or read.Bedtime
